title.rendered: Durham Students Free to Go Home Early Due to Coronavirus

content.rendered:
Durham University will scrap face to face teaching next week and students will be free, if they chose to, to go home early.

In an email to students this afternoon , the University stated that: “We will make every effort to ensure that all of you can participate in classes remotely until the Easter break.

You will also be able to access online materials over the Easter break for revision purposes.”

The Library will remain open until the end of term.

College accomodation will also operate as normal next week.

It is unclear at the moment if students will return to Durham in the final term.

There have been a total of twelve cases of Coronavirus in the North East.

Health officials confirmed the first case in County Durham on Tuesday in Darlington.

England’s deputy chief medical officer recently stated the peak coronavirus epidemic in the UK is expected within the next fortnight. At the time of writing, cases have risen to a total of 456 with eight deaths so far.
